meanings.definition: A small, enclosed field for grazing or pasture.
meanings.sent1: The horses roamed freely in the paddocks.
meanings.sent2: The cows were happily munching on grass in the paddocks.
meanings.sent3: The sheep in the paddocks seemed to be playing a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The paddocks were like cozy blankets wrapping around the animals.
meanings.sent5: The paddocks were painted with shades of green and gold under the sun.

meanings.definition: To confine animals in a paddock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer paddocks the sheep before the storm.
meanings.sent2: She paddocks the chickens every evening before dusk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat always finds a way to escape being paddocked.
meanings.sent4: He paddocks the horses with care, ensuring they have enough space to move.
meanings.sent5: Paddock the cows gently to keep them safe and content.

meanings.definition: The act of fencing off an area for animals to graze.
meanings.sent1: The paddocking of the meadow was completed before winter.
meanings.sent2: The paddocking of the hillside took days of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The paddocking of the field was a community effort.
meanings.sent4: The paddocking of the pasture was necessary to rotate the grazing areas.
meanings.sent5: The paddocking of the land ensured the animals stayed safe and well-fed.
